inscription: paper label verso backing, ink: P517 Cond A / Factory Ford St. P
text: Paul Shambroom investigates how power is organized, displayed, and exercised in the United States. Through long-term projects photographing a wide range of subjects, including nuclear facilities, municipal meetings, and civic landscapes, he combines documentary access with a meticulous, large-format aesthetic. His images reveal the often unseen environments in which authority is negotiated, exposing both the ordinary and symbolic dimensions of democratic life. Shambroom’s significance within the field of contemporary photography lies in his ability to merge visual clarity with social inquiry, encouraging viewers to reconsider the spaces and systems that shape collective decision-making. As an artist who has dedicated his life to this work, and in recent decades to mentoring rising talents in the field, his work remains influential for its depth, rigor, and cultural relevance.
title: Ford Motor Company, St. Paul, Minnesota (truck assembly)
